column2: Taking responsibility for the complete hardware lifecycle of our RF/Microwave/millimetre products, from system concept to system integration, and providing production support.       Producing robust and high-quality designs, ensuring thorough documentation and configuration management of your work, and delivering progress reports and plans.   Developing multifunctional designs for RF PCB and Modules, utilizing the latest technologies available, and enhancing your knowledge of essential design and manufacturing processes.   Designing with test in mind, building test prototypes for validating the design, and providing support for production testing.   Performing all detailed design tasks from capturing requirements to verifying the design. ensuring design reviews are completed successfully.   Preparing robust manufacturing data packs and provide technical support to sub-contracts and engineering interface with manufacturing.     Working closely with Systems, Test and Electronics engineers you will perform environmental and performance testing on RF hardware to validate analysis and demonstrate compliance to design criteria   Establish an efficient product lifecycle starting in the supply chain all the way through final integration that balances cost, complexity, and quality; work closely with partner teams to design and realize an efficient in-house production line   Own product delivery timeline through conception, design, assembly, and launch   Demonstrate extreme ownership of product outcomes at every stage of development and production     Preferred Skills and Experience:    You do not need to meet 100% of the preferred qualifications to be considered.    Proficiency in RF Microwave passive and active Sub-System Design   Familiarity with microwave design tools such as AWR, ADS and Matlab   Experience with designing RF front end s for software defined radio s for satellite applications   Skills in RF synthesizer design using DDS and PLL technologies   Expertise in designing passive microwave structures such as antennas, filters and diplexers etc   Experience in using EM 3D and 2D simulation techniques, including ANSOFT HFSS   Familiarity with low phase noise design and measurement   Proficiency in non-linear circuit simulation   Experience with PCB schematic capture tools such as Altium   Ability to perform lab measurements such as signal generation, spectrum analysis, and vector network analysis   Knowledge of microwave component selection   Experience in requirements capture and management   Ability to write technical reports   Experience with design reviews and lifecycle management   Understanding of design for manufacture and cost.    Proficiency in one or more programming languages   Very strong communication, teamwork and organizational skills   Ability to work effectively across multi-disciplinary teams     Qualifications     First degree (BTech, MTech, PhD) in Electronics Communications Engineering (preferably specialisation in microwave engineering) or related science (eg Physics).   6-10 years of experience with RF/Microwave and millimeter wave systems design and analysis (internship and outside the classroom project experience qualifies)

column2: A leading  Defense & Aerospace MNC is looking for an inspiring and dynamic Assistant Manager  Logistics who will be responsible for ensuring that products, inventory, parts, or people move from one place to another efficiently and cost-effectively. They plan, control, and implement the storage and flow of products, materials, information, or services.[Key responsibilities:Responsible for managing the entire logistic cycle and inventory management including repair, procurement, and maintenance.ETA Regulations: Logistic personnel is responsible for ensuring compliance with ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) regulations, which govern the timely delivery of goods. This includes monitoring shipment schedules, tracking shipment status, and communicating with stakeholders to provide accurate ETA updates and minimize delays.Transportation: Managing the distribution and transportation of goods from the manufacturer to the consumer. Understanding different modes of transportation such as road, rail, air, and sea, including their advantages, limitations, and suitability for various types of cargo and distances.Carrier Selection: Knowledge of selecting appropriate carriers based on factors such as cost, transit time, reliability, capacity, and special requirements (e.g.,temperature-controlled shipping for perishable goods).Warehouse Management: Managing warehouse operations, including receiving, storing, and shipping of goods.Develop and enforce safety procedures to ensure a safe working environment for warehouse staff.Regulatory Compliance: Awareness of transportation regulations, import/export regulations, customs procedures and clearance, and other legal requirements governing logistics operations. This includes knowledge of international trade compliance, hazardous materials handling and packaging, permits, licenses, weight restrictions,and transportation security regulations. Risk Management: Ability to identify transportation risks such as delays, damages, theft, and disruptions and implement risk mitigation strategies such as insurance coverage, contingency planning, and alternative routing. IT systems: Use logistics software and IT systems to streamline operations. Responsible for planning, executing, and optimizing the movement of goods. This includes knowledge of route optimization, carrier selection, and freight cost analysis.Managing shipping bills by ensuring that the bill accurately reflects the shipment details.Managing billing cycleand reconciling billing discrepancies.Negotiating and managing contracts with carriers, freight forwarders, warehousing providers, and other service providers involved in the logistics supply chain. Working closely with freight forwarders and selecting appropriate freight forwarders.Managing relationships with suppliers, including vendor selection, performance evaluation, and contract negotiation. Knowledge of strategies for improving supplier collaboration, reducing lead times, and ensuring supply chain resilience.Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and cost savings in logistics operations through innovation and best practices.Data analysis: Analyze data to assess performance, discover logistical problems, and devise plans for improvement.Preferred candidate profile 8 years Plus experience in Logistics, ICD, Customs, etc. in a manufacturing organization, preferably electronics or defense & aerospace industry.Knowledge of end-to-end logistics operations (including maritime, over-the-road, rail, customs, and warehousing)Knowledge of SAPGood communication skills- English, Hindi & TeluguWilling to travel extensively
column13: Customs, ICD, Warehouse Operations, Logistics Operations, Logistics Coordination, Transport Operations

column2: Roles, responsibilities and requirements1) CNC Programming: Develop and optimize CNC programs for 3 axis / 5-axis machining centers using CAM software (NX CAM) based on engineering drawings and models. 2) Tool Selection & Setups: Select appropriate cutting tools, fixtures, and work holding devices for each machining operation. Set up machines with the necessary tools and fixtures to ensure efficient and accurate production.3) FAIs & Production: Execute and monitor the process to ensure parts are machined according to specified tolerances and quality standards. Make adjustments as necessary to maintain optimal machine performance4) Quality: Perform inspection of machined parts for FAI?? using precision measuring instruments (such as micrometers, calipers, and CMMs) to verify dimensional accuracy and quality. 5) Troubleshooting: Identify and troubleshoot issues related to CNC programming, tooling, machine setup, and machining processes. Implement corrective actions to resolve problems and optimize production efficiency.6) Documentation: Maintain accurate records as per AS9100 standards, tooling specifications, setup sheets, and production reports. Document any changes or modifications made to CNC programs or processes.7) Collaboration: Work closely with supply chain, manufacturing, and quality assurance teams to ensure effective communication and coordination throughout the production process. Provide technical support and expertise as neededRole & responsibilities Preferred candidate profile Perks and benefits

column2: Qualification : Graduate / AME Diploma    Previous experience : Minimum 3-5 years in aviation industry in a similar role    Sound Knowledge of computers and applications    Good communication skills and Interpersonal skills    Good team player    Knowledge of procurement required.      Job Roles & Responsibilities:      The stores executive will report to the Stores-Incharge.    He will be responsible for maintaining the Bonded store, Quarantine store and tool store and its related documents.    He will be responsible for the storage condition of the bonded store, Quarantine store and the tool store.    He should keep a proper record of salvageable / unsalvageable / serviceable / repairable / condemned items/parts.    He will obtain quotes from different vendors, make a comparison and upload the requisition in oracle for getting approval.    Once the PO is prepared, it will be his responsibility to submit the PO to finance department.    He will also be responsible to coordinate between finance department and the vendors for uninterrupted supply of spares for the maintenance.    It will be the duty of the stores executive to bring to the notice of the respective authorities of any deviation/mistakes that are observed in the stores department.    He will be responsible for keeping records of calibration of tools and precision instruments and sending them for periodic calibration.    He will be responsible for maintaining the records for fuel and consumables.    He will be responsible for all the incoming parts and their documentation and if satisfactory, sign the stores acceptance tag.    He will be responsible for maintaining the Store( Bonded, quarantine, tools , chemical and fuel etc.) as per compliance for DGCA guidelines.
column11: Any Graduate, Diploma in Any Specialization, Any Postgraduate
column13: Procurement, Interpersonal skills, Chemical, Aviation, Compliance, Ame, Store Executive, Oracle

column2: Position:       Asst Manager- Manufacturing Process EngineeringLocation:       Devanahalli, BangaloreIndustry:        Aerospace Engineering components manufacturerQualification: BE/BTech in Mechanical, Industrial Engineering, Production EngineeringExperience: 6 years of experience in architecting manufacturing process for detail parts, assemblies, and sub-assemblies.Job Description:This role is tasked to design manufacturing process by working in close concert with fixture designers, NC Programmers, quality personnel, machine operators, production, and operational personnel. Support operations to increase productivity and optimize process, toolings, machining programs and procedures.Knowledge of CAD tools like NX, CATIA is a must and be able to bring and propose automations to increase engineering throughput.Knowledge of aerospace metals including soft and exotic metals, knowledge of cutting tools, cutting method, optimized cutting parameter for maximum tool life and quality of cut is mustKnowledge of multi axis machines like MillTurn, Turn Mills, VMC, HMC,s, Turning, Grinding, Honing is necessaryStrong knowledge of process, fixture design, drawing GD & T, customer specifications (preferably Boeing, Colins, Airbus, Triumph, Safran)Strong knowledge of APQP, PPAP, PFMEA, AS and premier customer requirements is mustBe able to identify risks and challenges to come with mitigation plans.Knowledge of SAP on process related modules.Knowledge of manufacturing process for aerospace components, assemblies, and sub-assemblies. Familiar with cylindrical aerospace industry, variety of manufacturing concepts, practices, and procedures.Responsibilities:Perform detailed contract review to cover commercial and technical requirements as per customer POEnsuring technical feasibility, resource availability and allocationsLiaise closely with Business Development, Customer, Quality, Supply Chain, Production to identify project needs, risks, mitigation actions and timelinesDerive RM requirement, create item codes, BOM, Routing, build 3d modelsDevelop process flow diagram, spec matrix, gap analysis, detailed process design along with PFMEA to include fixture concept for machining, special process, assembly, cutting method, packing requitements to meet the requirements, estimated cycle time, tool cost, NRCCreate stage models, stage drawings, identify critical process characters and design characters, detailed instructions.Prepare process documentations APQP, PPAP requirements.Prove out of new process, do RRCA for any escapes.Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule, project costs, engineering change.Update PFMEA, lesson learnt to handover the project to production.Liaison with customers and suppliers. Provide internal technical training and technical support services as required.Work in conjunction with Production, Operations and Quality as necessary to understand business priorities.Role & responsibilities
